alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 28 at 4:25AM MST until November 29 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches. Local amounts up to 24 inches possible above 9500 feet. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Mountain Ranges. * WHEN...5 PM MST this afternoon until 11 PM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Mountain travel will become extremely dangerous or impossible due to icy, snow packed roads and very low visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Outdoor recreation could become life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers may easily become disoriented. Frostbite and hypothermia can develop quickly.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
